entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 17 at 12:13PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy rainfall could increase flows on rivers and streams this weekend... An increase of deep moisture will have the potential to produce heavy rainfall over portions of Southwestern Colorado and Eastern Utah. The rainfall can lead to quick increases in flows on rivers, stream and creeks. Most of the larger rivers and streams have the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:18AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Putnam and central Clay Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 118 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Middleburg to 6 miles northwest of Bostwick. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:12AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central St. Johns County through 200 AM EDT... At 111 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vilano Beach, or near Saint Augustine, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 2:57PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... Relative humidity values of 25 percent or lower will be in store for four hours or more Sunday afternoon and evening. With dry fuels, elevated fire conditions are expected. entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 17 at 12:13PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy rainfall could increase flows on rivers and streams this weekend... An increase of deep moisture will have the potential to produce heavy rainfall over portions of Southwestern Colorado and Eastern Utah. entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 18 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Very warm temperatures will continue through the weekend. These temperatures, combined with windy conditions, will result in significant high-mountain snowmelt once again. It is likely most small streams and creeks, and possibly some main stem rivers, will likely reach high levels again. Currently only bankfull conditions (Action Stage) to minor low-land flooding (Minor Stage Flooding) is
entry.cap:areaDesc: Big Horn; Fremont; Hot Springs; Johnson; Park; Teton; Washakie

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Warm temperatures since Thursday have caused higher elevation snow melt to occurred again. Water levels in the Medicine Lodge Creek have risen since last night, as a result. This trend is expected to continue tonight into Sunday. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected.
